intro: Phlomoides stenocalycina, commonly known as the narrow calyx phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It produces small, four-lobed fruits that contain tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This species is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
